description: A cunning pack predator, once extinct in the northern island from the Japanese archipielago. Once revered yet feared in ancient Japan, the animal suffered a directed campaign of extermination during the 19th and early 20th centuries.  Similar in size to a North American wolf, both were considered to be close cousins before the Cataclysm, if not the same species only separated by geography.
//: Generic Ezou wolf. Basically a North American wolf that got stuck in Hokkaido, however these seemed to ignore humans except under arduous circumstances. Probably only the youkai version should spawn as they're a higher risk for the player

description: A cunning pack predator, once extinct in the three southern islands from the Japanese archipielago. Once revered in ancient Japan, the animal suffered the consequences of human activities in modern times, not to mention the active persecution during the 19th and early 20th centuries.  Smaller than a North American wolf, it's still a wolf regardless.
//: Generic non-Ezou wolf. Probably only the youkai version should spawn as they're a higher risk for the player

description: Also known as Tasmanian wolf, or Coorinna, among several other aboriginal names.  Not actually a member of the Canidae family, but a marsupial like roos and opossums, this gray, long and short dog-looking animal has a bunch of characteristic black stripes on the back.  Considered to be the apex predator of some Oceanic regions, not much is known about the behavior of this nocturnal animal.
//: Previously extinct in the Outside world, they were passively transferred to Gensokyo at some point in the past.
//2: These technically should have zombie versions, but I don't like that idea

description: An tiny, cute and defenseless Thylacine puppy.
